result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Matthew Jay Arrowood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Court calls 16CF56 & 17CF88  @ 11:06 am. Defendant Matthew Jay Arrowood in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives plea agreement, Submitted statement for uncharged read in for 16CF56, 16CF56 plea to ct 1, Defer Judgment, DRI Ct 2, ct 3 & 4 plea, withheld sentence 18 months probation, costs, DNA Surcharge, no contact with T. A. Restitution for 5854.03, Counseling deemed necessary by agent, if completes probation dismiss ct 1, 17CF88 Dismissed. Atty Schultz agrees and makes statement with L.A. will not be charged, def is not admitting to read ins pursuant to statute, Restitution is for read in charges. Def. agrees to plea agreement.  Victim rights complied with and makes statement. Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights filed.  Def. understands charges and penalties.  16CF56 Ct 1 Prepare/make fraud insurance claim, no contest plea,  ct 3 Resisting, no contest plea, ct 4 Resisting, no contest plea. Ct 2 DRI, Court notes uncharged read in, Atty Schultz has to different version and if can provide documents State may look at it. State would look at it for Restitution.  Atty Schultz replys.  17CF88 Dismissed. Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements.  Atty Schultz gives court Jury Instructions for Fraud charge. Atty Schultz is satisfied and makes statement on uncharged read ins. Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given. Factual basis.  Court finds factual basis, accepts plea and finds def. Guilty to 16CF56 ct 1 Fraud but will defer entry of judgment will be dimissed if complies with agreement, Atty Schultz replys, Judge will continue but delay entry of judgment on ct 1, and finds def. Guilty to Resisting in Ct's 3 & 4. State gives sentencing recommendations and request court to adopt.  Atty Schultz gives sentencing arguments.  Def. makes statement.  Court has represented def. is old case. Court orders on ct 1 Defer Judgment for 18 months and on Ct's  3 & 4 withheld sentence 18 months probation each ct, costs, $200 DNA Surcharge on ct 3 only, waive on ct 4 and sample, No contact with T.A.,  Restitution on uncharged read in $5854.03, Counseling deemed necessary by agent. Costs paid today or through probation, No credit, If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def advised of postconviction rights.  Probation is concurrent on ct's 3 &4, Review date for ct 12-20-18 @ 1 pm.  Def. questions agent.  State advise Court that def will be supervised by Merrill, Report to Lincoln Co close of business Monday.

Defendant Matthew Jay Arrowood in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 10:37 a.m. Scheduled for motion to dismiss. Statement by Atty Schultz regarding pending resolution of all matters. Statement by DA. Jury trial scheduled for 16CF56 will be off and set for plea and sentencing with this case.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Final pre-trial on July 24, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial on August 7, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Copy mailed to Atty. Henry Schultz on 12-9-16

Final pre-trial on March 27, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial on April 12, 2017 at 09:00 am.
of Proceedings. Preliminary Hearing held August 3, 2016

Ex # 1 - Copy of Insurance Loss Report
Ex # 2 - Copy of Insurance Loss Report

Defendant Matthew Jay Arrowood in court with attorney Tara Maureen Guelzow.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 11:04 a.m. Investigator Greg Carter duly sworn on oath, testifies. Witness identifies Def. Exhibit 1 - Copy of 2/23/16 insurance loss report. Exhibit 2 - Copy of 10/30/15 insurance loss report. Exhibits 1 & 2 offered and admitted. Arguments by Counsel. Court finds probable cause and binds over. Information filed. Copy received. Not guilty pleas to all counts. Court receives pleas and directs entry into record. Def advised does not have to attend status conf. but should stay in contact with atty. Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Matthew Jay Arrowood in court with attorney Tara Maureen Guelzow.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Laufenberg in regards to bond.  Complaint received, not reviewed.  No objections to signature bond.  Court reads charges with possible penalties.  Court sets bond.  Time limits for preliminary hearing waived.  Court explains timely preliminary.  Def agrees to waive time limits.  Court will accept voluntary waiver.  Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
